ratings.comment: Natalie was the best Spanish professor I have had in the past 12 years of taking Spanish classes. She inspired me to work outside of class and was very accessible in her office hours. She was incredibly tough and insisted on our participation but it was all out of care for her students. It was a kick in the pants to take more initiative. Amazing.
A lot of people didn't like her, but I thought she was a great professor. She was very helpful and I learned a lot- more than I have in any other Spanish class.

Worst TA I've had at UW-Madison.  At first she comes off as very nice and helpful but after about the first week she becomes very rude and unhelpful.  Her tests do not reflect what she teaches and she makes them very challenging.  She is very hostile and she puts you down if you do not know the correct answer.  Overall a TERRIBLE TA !

In all my years of education from elementary to collegiate, I have never had such an incompetent, disorganized, and blatantly rude teacher in all my life. Avoid taking any class with her at all costs. worst experience of my college career so far.

Natalie is a good TA to have, although her 311 class was quite difficult. She is pretty nice although she also may be intimidating sometimes. She definitely values participation. She is helpful if you go to see her in her office hours but not very communicative over email. If you want a challenge, I would suggest her.
Really passionate about teaching. However, is an incredibly tough grader.

She will say things are right and then not give you points for them. She takes so many points off for the littlest mistakes.  She thinks that everytime you ask a question so that you can become more fluent and a better writer, you are just point-grabbing and she shows her disdain.  Sig hw and not an efficient use of class time. Take a diff TA!!!!!!

After first, comes off as a cool teacher but soon reveals herself to be rather mean. One of those annoying literature professors that says they want to hear different opinions but then says you're wrong. She says she's always willing to help but her condescension and rudeness makes me dread even thinking about having to go to her for help. Avoid!

Not a very good TA. Gets very upset if you don't constantly participate. Comes off as nice, but is not very helpful especially in class. Refuses to answer questions over email, even if you cannot attend her office hours which are only once a week. Take a different TA if at all possible!

Not one of of my better TA's. I had a different TA for the first half of the semester and it was very difficult to adjust to Natalie because she assigns way more work, and her class is way less organizaed than other TA's. She also is not very helpful. If you have a question about a paper, she won't answer it in class. Overall, take a different TA.

Natalie was a great 203 TA. I learned more from her in one semester than I did taking spanish for 5 years in high school. She kept class interesting and kept it moving along. Expect monotonous homework due for every class. Exams are fair and she does want to help you, as long as you seek her out. Definitely recommend her for 203!

She does not come off as a nice person at all. Is very condescending when you make mistakes. Assigns too much homework. Gives difficult tests that no one does well on and does not curve them. Do not take a course with her. She is very knowledgeable in regards to spanish, but I dreaded going to her class, and often felt discouraged from speaking.

Comes off as nice/has a sense of humor, but actually is kind of mean.  An A-hoarder...the smartest kids don't even get A's (and there's no curve).  Tries to be fair and challenging, but this often works to the students' disadvantage.
